R E : A planned t r i p t o Belleville
Hi  Feng,I would also like t o add m y congratulations! It  has been a privilege working with you over the many years - I owe a greatdeal o f m y paycheque t o y o u r excellent w o r k and I have enjoyed working w i t h such a nice guy.
I hope that you enjoy your well-deserved retirement.
I l o o k forward t o talking t o y o u when y o u are i n Belleville.
Regards, Peter
----Original Message--
From: L y n c h , John [BVW:9T52:EXCH]Sent: Friday , October 08, 2004 8:59 AMTo: P e t r o v i c , Sladjana  [BVW:9T52:EXCH];  Q u e n n e v i l l e , Dwayne  [BVW:9T52:EXCH];  R o s s , Denis  [BVW:9T52:EXCH];  P o t h i e r , Dennis[BVW:9T52:EXCH];  Johnson, T rystan [BVW:9T52:EXCH];  T o z e r , William  [BVW:9P73:EXCH]Cc: T arle, Peter [BVW:9T51:EXCH];  Petrovic, Sreten [BVW:9P71:EXCH];  L i u , F e n g [SC101:9T52:EXCH]; L u , G a r y [BVW:9P73:EXCH];F l e s c h , T e r r y [HUMB:3065:EXCH];  K a z m a r e k , W i t o l d [BVW:9T50:EXCH];  O u t r a m , R o b e r t [BVW:9P40:EXCH]Subject: FW:  A planned trip t o Belleville
Congratulations Feng! Y ou will  be missed.
I look forward to this visit.
Here  is  o u r opportunity t o t r y t o absorb years o f experience i n a matter o f days.Get you ideas t o Feng o n additional topics t o cover so he has time t o prepare.
Here is  my start at additional topics I would like your perspective on:1 . Issues i n multi-customer & multi tenant system engineering2 . opportunities f o r product/tool improvement i n engineering IP  systems3 . Issues i n scaling users t o 30K, 50K, 100K, . . . users4 . Review  o f engineering TDM  service circuits f r o m CS  1000M  a n d CS  1000E  perspective: Conference, T D S , DTR,Applications (CP , M I X X ) , R A N , trunks5 . Call Center engineering considerations.6. Real customer experiences o f engineering theory vs reality.7 . When an SE  calls f o r help, the "top ten" questions asked t o understand their situation and respond appropriately.8 . NNEC what i t does and opportunities f o r improvement.
Regards,
John Lynch613-967-5198 (ESN  343-5198)jlynch@nortelnetworks.com
-..-Original  Message----
From: L i u , F e n g [SC101:9T52:EXCH]Sent: T h u r s d a y , O c t o b e r 0 7 , 2 0 0 4 6 : 0 4 PMTo: L y n c h , John [BVW:9T52:EXCH]Cc: K a c z m a r e k , W i t o l d [BVW:9T50:EXCH]Subject: A planned t r i p t o Belleville
John,
I don't know  whether W i t o l d has t o l d y o u this  information y e t . I have applied t o take the  voluntary exit  package, a n d willretire from Nortel at  the end o f December, 2004.
W itold wants m e t o travel t o Belleville t o d o a tech transfer i n mid-November . I am  i n the  process o f submitting aTravel Authorization form.
1

--- Page 2 ---
M y current plan is  t o do three 3-4 hours presentation: (1) Trafﬁc theory and engineering practices (2) CS1000M/ESystem Algorithms, ( 3 ) I n depth analysis o f VT-MC-SS Engineering spreadsheet.
The tentative schedule is:
11/15 Monday . Leaving San Jose1 1 / 1 6 Tuesday . Morning, presentation ( 1 ) , afternoon open1 1/17 Wednesday. Morning, presentation (2), afternoon open11/18 Thursday. Morning, presentation (3), afternoon open1 1/19 Friday . Morning, open. Afternoon, leaving f o r Toronto airport.
I f different subjects are preferred, we can discuss about i t . I will  need sometime to prepare f o r the presentation. I n themeantime, I can continue doing some short tasks, such as enhancing Multi-Customer Engineering report, tacklingsome subjects i n Sladjana's Node/zone engineering proposal, and consultations, etc.
It  has been a pleasant and rewarding experience working with you and the group, I will  treasure the few weeks stillahead of me at Nortel.
Regards,
Feng

A planned trip t o Belleville
John,
I don't know whether Witold has told you this information y e t . I have applied t o take the voluntary exit package, and willretire from Nortel at the end o f December, 2004.
Witold wants me t o travel t o Belleville t o do a tech transfer i n mid-November. I am i n the process o f submitting aTravel Authorization form.
M y current plan is  t o do three 3-4 hours presentation: (1) Trafﬁc theory and engineering practices (2) CS1000M/ESystem Algorithms, ( 3 ) I n depth analysis o f VT-MC-SS Engineering spreadsheet.
T h e tentative schedule is:
11/15 Monday. Leaving San Jose
1 1/16 Tuesday. Morning, presentation (1), afternoon open11/17 Wednesday. Morning, presentation (2), afternoon open11/18 Thursday. Morning, presentation (3), afternoon open11/19 Friday. Morning, open. Afternoon, leaving f o r Toronto airport.
I f different subjects are preferred, we can discuss about i t . I will need sometime to prepare for the presentation. I n themeantime, I can continue doing some short tasks, such as  enhancing Multi-Customer Engineering report, tacklingsome  subjects i n Sladjana's Node/zone engineering proposal, a n d consultations, etc.
It  has been a pleasant and rewarding experience working w i t h y o u and the group, I will  treasure the few  weeks stillahead o f me  at  Nortel.
Regards,
Feng

L i u , F e n g [SC101:9T52:EXCH]R E : RPC 2950 - Trafﬁc alert
Feng,
So I hear you are leaving us t o enjoy life as a retired man. Good f o r y o u . Y ou will  be missed. It  has been a pleasureworki ng w i t h y o u . Y o u are always patient and understanding w h i c h I personally really appreciated. Thanks f o r answeringall  o f m y questions. Y o u are leaving some b i g shoes t o ﬁ l l . Thanks again f o r everything and best o f l u c k i n the new  year.
F Y I - O f course I will  probably be calling you before you g o f o r other questions and stuf f. After all  I still have until the endo f the year to drive you crazy and pick your brain.
--Original Message-----
From: L i u , F e n g [SC101:9T52:EXCH]Sent: Friday , O c t o b e r 0 8 , 2 0 0 4 9 : 2 1 AMTo: O u t r a m , Robert  [BVW:9P40:EXCH];  D o c h e r t y , Robert  [BVW:9P60:EXCH];  Y e a z e l , I r e n e [EXES:7770:EXCH];  T e o , KaINGD:5011:EXCH]
Cc: L ynch, J o h n [BVW:9T52:EXCH]Subject: RE:  RPC 2950 - Trafﬁc alert
H i ! All,
I agree.
I discovered that a lot  o f program testers just arbitrarily change inputs (sets, trunks, etc.) without changingcorresponding conﬁguration parameters (intra-ofﬁce ratio, etc.), and expect the program t o yield a reasonable result. Iftrafﬁc is  not  balanced, additional sets will  not  cause the number o f Media Cards t o increase, since i f set CCS  has noplace (trunk) t o terminate, it  w i l l just pile u p t o the extra line CCS number and does not g o through the Algorithm tocalculate resource.
S o , i f the trafﬁc i s signiﬁcantly imbalanced, we  should demand better input data, a warning message is  not enough.
We could get b y with a warning message i n Meridian Conﬁgurator because the imbalance will  only impact CPUloading, and it  will  not show unless at  critical point (from within rated capacity to beyond). I n CS1000 systems, theadditional impact i s o n the number o f Media Cards, which either o v e r - o r under-provisioning will  have signiﬁcantperformance and cost impacts.
I am  glad this  issue is  ﬁ n a l l y settled.
Regards,
Feng

Subject: RE:  R P C 2 9 5 0 - Trafﬁc  alert
Irene,
Should be  a hard stop i f i t s that poorly imbalanced and ﬁ x e d before proceeding.
Rob

From: L i u , Feng [SC9:9P22:EXCH]
Sent: T uesday , August  2 1 , 2 0 0 1 12:57 PMT o : A r m o u r , Christopher [TOR:5335:EXCH]Cc:  S m i t h , D a v i d [TOR:9T80:EXCH];  L a n t h i e r , Louis  [BVW:9P20:EXCH]Subject: RE:  CallPilot/SCCS  channel limit  i n f o req'd & testing recommendations
Chris,
I am  able  t o get  this  email  done  a h e a d o f schedule, s o might  as  well  send i t t o y o u earlier.Please feel  free t o forward this t o additional team members w h o might  be  interested inthis subject.
M y calculation will  be based o n Option 1 1C/CSE1K, which is  real time  limited. I n otherwords, port/card requirement is  not  considered h e r e . I will  include a detailed calculationprocedure  here, s o y o u c a n p l u g - i n y o u r o w n numbers  i f y o u choose  parameters  differentfrom  m y "typical" numbers. I will  make  some  observation and comments a f t e r thecalculation.
All  real time numbers are based on current available RI25 data.
Rated capacity f o r 11C:  64,615 E B C (Equivalent Basic Call  - 2500-set t o 2500-set call)per hour
IP  call  capacity (tie-trunk call t o 1 2 0 0 4 sets): 7,875 (=2520,000/320) calls/hourReal time factor o f IP  call: 64615/7875 - 1 = 8.2-1 = 7 . 2 (call ratio minus one EBC)Call  Pilot real time factor = 1.68+2 = 3.68 (using Meridian Mail  numbers)
1 o f 10
